abstract: Agricultural Bank of China set a price range for the Shanghai part of its initial public offering that will allow it to raise as much as $20.1 billion, according to three people with knowledge of the matter.
snippet: Agricultural Bank of China set a price range for the Shanghai part of its initial public offering that will allow it to raise as much as $20.1 billion, according to three people with knowledge of the matter.
lead_paragraph: Agricultural Bank of China set a price range for the Shanghai part of its initial public offering that will allow it to raise as much as $20.1 billion, three people with knowledge of the matter told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: AgBank’s Shanghai Pricing Aims for $20 Billion
